alert.note: Alert for Laclede; Phelps; Pulaski; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:42AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Laclede, Pulaski, northwestern Texas and southwestern Phelps Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 241 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Leonard Wood, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rolla... Fort Leonard Wood... Waynesville... St. Robert... Doolittle... Newburg... Edgar Springs... Plato... Laquey... Devil`s Elbow... Jerome... Falcon... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 148 and 169, and between mile markers 171 and 185. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
